intro: Rourea acutipetala, commonly known as the sharp-leaved rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often sharply pointed, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Rourea acutipetala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
